channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-15610] Remove deprecated HConnection for 2.0 thus removing all PB references for 2.0
item.description: This is sub-task for HBASE-15174.
item.summary: Remove deprecated HConnection for 2.0 thus removing all PB references for 2.0

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: This seems to be a very serious task with lot of code using HConnection.

Yes, also externally, HConnection should be used a lot although deprecated since 1.0. We can decide to either:

  • Remove HConnection causing some effort for the users to change / fix their usage of Connection.
  • Remove only the PB related methods from HConnection, and have the interface deprecated in 2.0 still for the convenience of the users.

I vote for option #1, removing HConnection. We went by the book deprecating it (Was first deprecated in 0.99). Deprecation went in here:


commit cad76a3431aabe2aee67fcf564cb56af53f48a37

Author: Enis Soztutar <enis@apache.org>

Date:   Tue Sep 16 00:09:31 2014 -0700



    HBASE-11825 Create Connection and ConnectionManager (Solomon Duskis)

Another reason to purge it is because our Connection hierarchy has too much by way of progeny... its a pain navigating it all... HConnection is the ugly child. With it gone we'll be into a nice clean space where its Connection of the internal ClusterConnection and thats it.
Okie. Let me come with a plan for this. Need to consider the timeline also. But yes it is better to do it now as its been deprecated for a long time.

If option 1, we should also clean all HConnection related classes as well. HConnectionManager should be removed, ConnectionManager needs some cleaning.

HTable taking Configuration as argument may need to be removed as well.

This could be a big task. As a first step if we cannot cover the entire code base - atleast can we change the IA.public to IA.private and add it in release notes? Anyway I will try to take a stab and see how far I can go with this entire clean up.

I took the liberty to do the work of removing HConnection and all of its usage.

Please take a look at some of the methods moved from HConnection to ClusterConnection and the new MultiHConnection implementation

-1 overall

Thanks for doing this Jurriaan Mous. Seems fine to me on the first pass. So there are no more references to the Protos files also in any of the public facing interfaces/classes as part of this change? I can see HConnection totally removed. So should be ok now I believe.
Fix hadoopcheck failures.
Yes all publicly exposed Protos interfaces are removed with the removal of HConnection.

This is the only dodgy looking thing that I see:


1170	  protected AdminProtos.AdminService.BlockingInterface getAdmin(final ServerName serverName,

1254	    final boolean master)	1171

We go from public to protected. It is in a Deprecated class but you seem to move the difference between HConnection and ClusterConnection into CC elsewhere except here. Maybe you have reasoning? Might be less risky leaving this public but deprecating it? (It looks like it is useless/unused so could do the above...)

Otherwise, +1.
Jurriaan Mous See above sir.

It was in HConnection interface and there the method was already deprecated. And ConnectionImplementation is IA.private

* @deprecated You can pass master flag but nothing special is done.

// Nothing is done w/ the 'master' parameter. It is ignored.

Maybe I should remove the method and move code to method without flag because the flag is not used? Or should it first be Deprecated in the Private ConnectionImplementation?

Because AdminProtos.AdminService.BlockingInterface getAdmin(final ServerName serverName, final boolean master) was already deprecated in HConnection I now remove it completely. The deprecation message says correctly the master boolean is not used within the code.

(I can change it to deprecated if you stack think otherwise but I thought to already add this patch to have it checked out by QA)
